Description: The MiLB season for this player.
The MiLB team ID for this player.
Example: "260" (Tulsa Drillers, Double-A), "445" (Columbus Clippers, Triple-A) , "5370" (ACL Giants Orange, Arizona Complex League)

Description: The abbreviation for the MiLB team of this player.
Example: "TUL" (Tulsa Drillers, Double-A), "COL" (Columbus Clippers, Triple-A) , "GNTO" (ACL Giants Orange, Arizona Complex League)

Description: The name for the MiLB team this player played for.
The League ID for the MiLB team this player played for.
Example: "109" (Texas League, Double-A), "221" (International League, Triple-A), "560" (Arizona Complex League, Rookie)

Description: The League abbreviation for the league that the MiLB team exists in.
Example: "TEX" (Texas League, Double-A), "INT" (International League, Triple-A), "ACL" (Arizona Complex League, Rookie)

Description: The MiLB level this team plays in.
The Abbreviation for the MiLB level.
The Player ID for this player
Example: "663734" (The player ID for Nick Neidert, a pitcher for the 2023 Iowa Cubs baseball team, a team that playes in the International League, at the Triple-A level.)

Description: The full name for this player
The real first name of this player.
The Real last name of this player.
The first name used by this player. This can be differient from `player_first_name`, but is typicaly equal to `player_first_name`.
The player's name, formatted as `{player_use_name[0]} {player_last_name}`.
The primary position(s) of this player for this team/season.
The number of wins (if any) attributed to this player as a pitcher.
The number of losses (if any) attributed to this player as a pitcher.
The win percentage of this pitcher with this team.
The ERA of this pitcher. Calculates the average of earned runs allowed by a pitcher per nine innings pitched (i.e. the traditional length of a game). Formula is `9 * (pitching_ER / pitching_IP)`.
The RA/9 of this pitcher. Similar to ERA, but includes unearned runs as well. Formula is `9 * (pitching_R / pitching_IP)`.
The number of apperances as a pitcher for this player for this team in this season.
The number of apperances as a starting pitcher for this player for this team in this season.
The number of times as a pitcher for this player for this team in this season, where this player was the final pitcher used for that game.
The number of times as a starting pitcher for this player for this team in this season, where this player was the only pitcher used in a game that lasted at least 8 innings.
The number of times in this season and with this team, where the player as a starting pitcher pitched at least 6 innings, and allowed 3 earned runs or fewer.
The number of times as a starting pitcher for this season and this team, where this player was the only pitcher used, and allowed zero (0) runs.

The number of apperances where as the final pitcher used, one of the following conditions is true: A. Their team is leading by 3 runs or less, and pitches at least one (1) full inning. B. The pitcher enters the game with the tying run in the on-deck circle, or the opposition team is closer to scoring. C. Pitch at least three innings, as the final pitcher used.
In tandem with "Pitching - Save Opportunities (SVO)", this is the number of times where a pitcher entered into the game with a save opportunity, and his team won.

In tandem with "Pitching - Save Opportunities (SVO)", this is the number of times where a pitcher entered into the game with a save opportunity, did not finish the game, but did not squander the lead while in the game as a pitcher.

In tandem with "Pitching - Save Opportunities (SVO)", this is the number of times where a pitcher entered into the game with a save opportunity, and his team lost the game, because this player allowed the tying run and/or go ahead run to score.

The number of innings pitched by this player, in decimal form. For example, a player who pitches 10 1/3 innings will have that represented as "10.333". A player that appears as a pitcher, but records exaclty zero (0) outs will be credited as pitching 0 innings.

The number of innings pitched by this player, but properly formatted for baseball. For example, a player who pitches 10 1/3 innings will have that represented as "10.1". A player that appears as a pitcher, but records exaclty zero (0) outs will be credited as pitching 0 innings.
The number of batters this player had to pitch against. If a player faces off against the opposition's batting lineup twice (2), they are credited as facing off agianst 18 batters.

Full Column Name: Pitching - Ground into Double Play Opportunities
Pitching - Walks plus Hits per Inning Pitched (WHIP)
Pitching - Batting Average for Balls in Play (BABiP)
Pitching - Home Runs per Plate Appearance (HR/PA)
